definitions.definition: in a way that is just possible but only with difficulty

examples.text: He could barely read and write.
She was barely able to stand.
We barely had time to catch the train.

definitions.definition: in a way that almost does not happen or exist
just; certainly not more than (a particular amount, age, time, etc.)

examples.text: He was barely 20 years old and already running his own company.
They arrived barely a minute later.

definitions.definition: only a very short time before

examples.text: I had barely started speaking when he interrupted me.
